      • readRawFile

        public static String readRawFile(String path)
                          throws IOException

      • cleanRawText

        public static String cleanRawText(String rawText,
                                  String whiteListedRegex,
                                  String[] blackListedRegexes)
        Builds a new String based on the given one but with certain character spans replaced with whitespace based on the given regular expressions. In practice, this is used for raw XML tokenization, where is it necessary to filter from the raw file text unwanted items such as XML tags and extraneous XML elements.
        Parameters:
        whiteListedRegex - An expression the represents the character spans in the given text to preserve. All surrounding spans will be replaced with whitespace.
        blackListedRegexes - Expressions that represent the character spans that are present within the whitespace areas to replace with whitespace.

      • cleanRawText

        public static String cleanRawText(String rawText,
                                  String whiteListedRegex,
                                  int maxNumWhiteListedSpansToRead,
                                  String[] blackListedRegexes)
        Builds a new String based on the given one but with certain character spans replaced with whitespace based on the given regular expressions. In practice, this is used for raw XML tokenization, where is it necessary to filter from the raw file text unwanted items such as XML tags and extraneous XML elements.
        Parameters:
        whiteListedRegex - An expression the represents the character spans in the given text to preserve. All surrounding spans will be replaced with whitespace.
        maxNumWhiteListedSpansToRead - The maximum number of whitelisted spans to read. Any remaining are discarded.
        blackListedRegexes - Expressions that represent the character spans that are present within the whitespace areas to replace with whitespace.

      • replaceSubstringWithSpaces

        public static String replaceSubstringWithSpaces(String str,
                                                int begin,
                                                int end)
        Build a new string where the substring from begin (inclusive) to end (exclusive) has been replaced with spaces.

      • searchByRegex

        public static CharOffset searchByRegex(String s,
                                       String regex)
        Like String.indexOf(String), but search for a regex pattern instead of a literal string.
        Returns:
        a CharOffset representing the first regex match, or null if no match was found.

      • searchByRegex

        public static CharOffset searchByRegex(String s,
                                       int fromIndex,
                                       String regex)
        Like String.indexOf(String, int), but search for a regex pattern instead of a literal string.
        Returns:
        a CharOffset representing the first regex match, or null if no match was found.

                             String tagName)
        Locate the first given tag in the given XML string.
        Parameters:
        tagName - The tag for which to search.
        Returns:
        The index of the first tag, or -1 if it was not found.

      • getResourceListing

        public static String[] getResourceListing(Class<?> clazz,
                                          String path)
                                   throws URISyntaxException,
                                          IOException
        List directory contents for a resource folder. Not recursive. This is basically a brute-force implementation. Works for regular files and also JARs.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Any java class that lives in the same place as the resources you want.
        path - Should end with "/", but not start with one.
        Returns:
        Just the name of each member item, not the full paths.
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException - the uRI syntax exception
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
